description.raw:
issue #2130

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec [pdf](https://www.khronos.org/files/collada_spec_1_5.pdf), the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: `<transparent>` and `<transparency>` but we were only using the latter value. 

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per [ogre Pass documentation](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/manual/manual_16.html#scene_005fblend). It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec pdf, the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: <transparent> and <transparency> but we were only using the latter value.

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per ogre Pass documentation. It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.

title: Fix collada loader transparency

summary.raw:
issue #2130

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec [pdf](https://www.khronos.org/files/collada_spec_1_5.pdf), the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: `<transparent>` and `<transparency>` but we were only using the latter value. 

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per [ogre Pass documentation](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/manual/manual_16.html#scene_005fblend). It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.
summary.html:
issue #2130

now that mesh material transparency values are actually being used after pull request #2536, it exposed a problem reading the collada texture transparency value. Looking at the collada spec pdf, the final transparency value is calculated based on two attributes: <transparent> and <transparency> but we were only using the latter value.

The blend factor src and dst factor values also seem to be reversed as per ogre Pass documentation. It doesn't look like they are being used at the moment when creating the visual but I reversed them anyway to be consistent with the intended usage.
